metadata.synopsis:
Alfira is a young bard who was apprenticed to a woman called Lihala. On their journey to the camp, they were attacked by gnolls, and Lihala died horribly.
Alfira is trying to compose a song in honour of the teacher she loved so dearly, but is struggling. The player can help her play, talk ther through the lyrics, steal her instrument, or even convince her to give up music.
This is a very soft and touching moment in the grove. Should Alfira finish her song (with the aid of the player) she will stand up and sing it in a cinematic scene.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 280; 4984. Talk to Alfira

21.speaker: Alfira
21.text: I'm not cut out to be a bard. Or much else, if I'm honest.
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock. No lute. Arms around herself - devastated. NodeContext: Dejected. Devastated.

181.speaker: Alfira
181.text: Guess I'll see what Baldur's Gate brings.
181.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock. No lute.NodeContext: Dejected. Devastated.

52.speaker: Alfira
52.text: Sorry, I need to do this on my own.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself. She wants to finish the song but it isn't going anywhere.

69.speaker: Alfira
69.text: Leave me alone. I mean it.
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing. Holding lute close.NodeContext: Player stole but then returned her instrument. She's a little afraid and just wishes to be left alone.

73.speaker: Alfira
73.text: It was right here. Someone must have taken it.
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is standing. looking around frantically. Gesturing in a 'wtf' fashion. NodeContext: Her teacher's lute is missing. It means the world to her and she's heartbroken and angry that someone would take it. Also blames herself for not keeping a better eye on it.

201.speaker: Player
201.text: You already have an instrument. Why do you need another?

151.speaker: Alfira
151.text: It was my teacher's. And it's - it's all I have left.
151.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is still standing next to the rock.NodeContext: Player has asked about the missing lute. She's upset and angry.

224.speaker: Alfira
224.text: I'm not going to ask where you got this. Just... thank you. Now, please leave.
224.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is still standing at the end of the node.NodeContext: Suspects the player had something to do with it. Doesn't want to know. Just wants to be left alone with her lute. Doesn't want the trouble.

143.speaker: Alfira
143.text: I should never have let it out of my sight. I'm an idiot.
143.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is still standing at the end of the node.NodeContext: Almost on the brink of tears at the thought of the missing lute. Feels stupid. Like it's her fault and she's nothing but useless.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: Consider this a lesson - don't be careless.

260.speaker: Player
260.text: You really should be more careful.

88.speaker: Alfira
88.text: Dance upon the stars tonight. Smile and pain will fade away. Words of mine will change - no. Become - ugh.
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lightly strumming her lute. Not looking at the player. NodeContext: Softly singing. Sadness in every note. There is a small pause between every line as you softly sing.

122.speaker: Alfira
122.context: NodeContext: Trying to make 'change' fit. Considering tone. Dammit is a curse as she dramatically yells. Angry at herself.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Tough audience. Those animals weren't shy with their criticisms.

290.speaker: Alfira
290.text: I... I thought they were cheering me on.
290.context: NodeContext: Sounds dejected. Surpised and sad.

53.speaker: Alfira
53.text: Urgh. Even animals think I'm terrible. I want to finish this song, but I can't - nothing fits, you know?
53.context: NodeContext: Frustrated with herself. Doesn't feel good enough.

249.speaker: Player
249.text: There's no singing voice that could save those lyrics. You know that, right?

185.speaker: Alfira
185.context: NodeContext: No is sad sadly, and then she barks a yes realising she's answered it wrong. Embarassed,

216.speaker: Alfira
216.text: I'm trying to finish this bloody song. And it's not... nothing fits, you know?
216.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself.

162.speaker: Alfira
162.text: More like butchering. Don't know why I bother.
162.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at lute - frustratedNodeContext: Speaking of her own music. Embarassed and frustrated with herself. Dejected.

254.speaker: Player
254.text: The animals agreed. Why else do you think they left?

12.speaker: Alfira
12.text: No. I'm moments away from a grisly death...
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at player. NodeContext: Sarcasm mixed with frustation.

239.speaker: Alfira
239.text: ...at the hands of this bloody song. I can't... nothing fits, you know?
239.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Let me see if I can help.

161.speaker: Player
161.text: That's the creative process for you. Agony and ecstasy. Mostly agony.

15.speaker: Alfira
15.text: True. And when you finally perfect a song... there's nothing like it.
15.context: NodeContext: Face lights up. Sounds truly happy and filled with wonder. Music is what she loves the most in life. It inspires her and gives her hope.

100.speaker: Alfira
100.text: But when you're stuck, and it's just getting worse - ugh.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Why are you songwriting now? Hardly the best time.

113.speaker: Alfira
113.text: I... we lost people on the way here.
113.context: NodeContext: She's thinking of her teacher who died on the way. Grief in her voice.

167.speaker: Alfira
167.text: And the dead deserve to be remembered. That's what my teacher always said.
167.context: NodeContext: She's thinking of her teacher who died on the way. Grief in her voice.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: Can I help you finish the song?

77.speaker: Alfira
77.context: NodeContext: Sad smile in her voice.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: This grove could become a battlefield soon enough. It's not the time for music.

213.speaker: Alfira
213.text: I know. I should be packing up, but I need to finish this song. It's... it's important.
213.context: NodeContext: Player has advised her to leave. But she can't - she has to finish her song. Frustrated, mainly at herself.

215.speaker: Player
215.text: Let me help you finish it, then.

150.speaker: Alfira
150.text: Hm. It can't hurt. I have her... I have an extra lute, if you want?
150.context: NodeContext: Hesitates at 'her'. This is her teacher's lute (who died on the way here). Needs the help and is looking for companionship while playing. Sounds unsure of herself.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Hand me that lute. We can perform together.

282.context: NodeContext: Seated position. Holding her OWN lute in her lap with one hand. Reaches behind  with RIGHT hand into 'magic pocket' and holds out her TEACHER'S lute. Player takes the teacher's lute.

262.speaker: Alfira
262.text: I'll start from the beginning. We'll take it slow.
262.context: CinematicNodeContext: Seated position. Holding her OWN lute in her lap with one hand. Reaches behind  with RIGHT hand into 'magic pocket' and holds out her TEACHER'S lute. Player takes the teacher's lute.NodeContext: Encouraging tone. She's thrilled someone will play music with her again.

137.speaker: Alfira
137.text: Dance upon the stars tonight... Smile and pain will fade away...
137.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player is holding the lute - ready to begin playing.NodeContext: Gently sung.

51.speaker: Alfira
51.text: Words of mine will turn to ash... When you call the last light down...
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and bard playing together. Player has a lute. Shot of the two playing in harmony as Alfira closes her eyes - it's a peaceful scene. NodeContext: Gently sung.

288.speaker: Alfira
288.text: That was... interesting. Why don't we try again?
288.context: CinematicNodeContext: Clanging sound as the player messes up - fingers banging against the lute. Bard winces in almost pain at the sound.

36.speaker: Alfira
36.text: Moon reminds me of your grace... All the love I can't repay... Rest and know that I will pray... Farewell, my dear old friend...
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and bard play together. Scenic shot as the bard closes her eyes and sings - peaceful. When she finishes singing puts away OWN lute in magic pocket. Player also puts the TEACHER'S  lute into their magic pocket at the end.NodeContext: Gently sung. Eyes closed.

94.speaker: Alfira
94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hiding her face as she cries, struggling to get herself under control. NodeContext: Face crumples as she begins bawling her eyes out. Cover her face. Embarassment in her voice as she tries to stop crying.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Don't worry. Cry as much as you need.

117.speaker: Alfira
117.text: Heh. She'd have said the same thing.
117.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wiping away her tears, getting herself together. NodeContext: Smiling as she wipes away her tears.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: That song was beautiful. Worthy of a few tears.

79.speaker: Alfira
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wiping away her tears, getting herself together. NodeContext: Smiling as she wipes away her tears. Player has complimented her music. She's calming down after getting upset.

70.speaker: Alfira
70.text: That's the first time I've played since Lihala died. My teacher.
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Can't look directly at the player. NodeContext: Sad and distant as she remembers the death of her teacher. Traumatised.

16.speaker: Alfira
16.text: She was playing her lute. We... didn't hear the gnolls coming.
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Can't look directly at the player. NodeContext: Catch in her voice. More horrified than on the brink of crying.

121.speaker: Alfira
121.text: There was so much blood. I - I can still smell it.

200.speaker: Alfira
200.text: It was awful. I couldn't look at a lute without hearing her - screaming.
200.context: NodeContext: Horrified.  Clearly traumitised as she recalls the death of her teacher. Her teacher's death prevented her from playing music again.

214.speaker: Player
214.text: I'm sure your teacher would be proud to see you now.

145.speaker: Alfira
145.text: Heh. She'd yell at me for that clunky verse. And make me play 'til my fingers were raw.
145.context: NodeContext: Recalling how her teacher would yell at her. Fondness and love in her voice, It's a nice memory.

92.speaker: Alfira
92.text: And that's exactly what I'm going to do: finish The Weeping Dawn - for her.
92.context: NodeContext: Determined. This is her chance to take back control in her life.

89.speaker: Alfira
89.text: I've a long way to go, but thank you. I... I needed this.
89.context: NodeContext: Putting her gratitude into words as best she can. Sincere and genuine.

203.speaker: Narrator
203.text: *Too sweet, odiously sweet. The vomitous gall within despairs at your kindness.*

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Hardly a unique tale of woe these days. Toughen up, or you won't last.

93.speaker: Alfira
93.text: Keep the lute. Please. You've earned it.
93.context: NodeContext: Big smile - cheerful and grateful

133.speaker: Alfira
133.text: The Weeping Dawn will be my gift to Lihala. I've a long way to go, but thank you. I... I needed this.
133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at player. NodeContext: Put her gratitude into words as best she can. Sincere and genuine.

275.speaker: Player
275.text: Well, you've come up with a fine tribute to her.

35.speaker: Alfira
35.text: Lihala said that's why eulogies were important. They were for the living as well as the dead.
35.context: NodeContext: Smile and a short laugh. Fondness and love in her voice as she recalls her teacher. Grief as she recalls that the eulogy she was writing was as much for her benefit as well as Lihalas.

234.speaker: Alfira
234.text: I'd forgotten what it was like: that itch to perfect a song.
234.context: NodeContext: Hope returning to her voice.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: No need to be sorry. Though it still needs work.

206.speaker: Alfira
206.text: Heh. And then some. But I have the bones of the song - and that's what matters.
206.context: NodeContext: Player has told her the song needs work. She laughs as she agrees. Hope and determination.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: Well, would you look at this grove. So lovely. So... grove-like.

136.speaker: Alfira
136.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wiping away her tears, getting herself together. NodeContext: Smiling as she wipes away her tears. Player has made a show of looking away and not crowding her when she's upset. It's made her laugh.

7.speaker: Alfira
7.text: Look, erm, I really appreciate the help. But I think I should continue on my own. Thanks anyway.
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: The lute twangs and the tiefling stopped singing. She looks awkwardly at you.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Slip the lute into your pack.

222.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player puts lute into magic pocket.

245.speaker: Alfira
245.text: Wait - what are you doing? Give that back! Right now!
245.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aflira puts her OWN lute into her magic pocket and frantically stands up.NodeContext: Player has just stolen her teacher's mandolin. Panic. It's the only thing she has of her teacher. Upset.

186.speaker: Alfira
186.text: Please. It was my teacher's. I don't have - I need it.

109.speaker: Alfira
109.text: You horrid, horrid beast. What is wrong with you?
109.context: NodeContext: Player has refused to return her teacher's lute. Upset. Horrified. In tears.

74.speaker: Alfira
74.text: Get the hells away from me.
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turnings away - furiousNodeContext: Starting to cry. Angry and upset.

220.speaker: Narrator
220.text: *Too sweet, odiously sweet. The vomitous gall within churns - she sickens you.*

189.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands the lute back to her.

18.speaker: Alfira
18.text: What is wrong with you? You told me you wanted to help!
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding her TEACHER's lute. Almost cradling it.NodeContext: Player stole her instrument and then returned it. Upset. Horrified. Betrayed.

273.speaker: Alfira
273.text: Get the hells away from me.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Here. I don't have time for this.

251.speaker: Alfira
251.text: Oh. All right. I mean - thanks anyway.
251.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks down at mandolin. NodeContext: Sad and dissappointed but trying to hide it.

29.speaker: Alfira
29.text: Where is it? Damn it. No, no!
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing up. Puts OWN lute away. Patting pockets AFTER. Looking around. NodeContext: Panicked.

38.speaker: Alfira
38.text: That was my teacher's. It's all I - I'm sorry. I have to find it.

32.speaker: Alfira
32.text: Hm. It can't hurt. What do you have in mind?
32.context: NodeContext: Hesitant. Wants the help but nervous.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: First things first - what's the song about?

76.speaker: Alfira
76.text: My teacher, Lihala. She loved dancing. Had two left feet, mind.
76.context: NodeContext: Smile in her voice as she thinks of her beloved teacher.

17.speaker: Alfira
17.text: I remember waking up one night on the road and seeing her - dancing beneath the stars... a huge smile on her face.
17.context: NodeContext: Laughs slightly as she thinks of the memory. Love in her voice.

277.speaker: Alfira
277.text: Thinking of it now - my heart hurts and my words just seem to crumble... like ash.

292.speaker: Alfira
292.text: Wait. Words of mine will turn to ash... That's perfect.
292.context: NodeContext: Excited. Inspiration is starting to return.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Nod in encouragement and gesture to her lute.

71.speaker: Alfira
71.text: Words of mine will turn to ash...
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gently and sadly singing.NodeContext: Gently feeling out the words of the song, and with it, the pain and grief she feels for her teacher. Getting excited.

65.speaker: Alfira
65.text: ...when you call the last light down...
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gently and sadly singing.NodeContext: Gently and sadly singing. Feeling out the words.

82.speaker: Alfira
82.context: NodeContext: Excited. You have the line and are holding the entirety of the song in your head - and you have to sing it or it will disappear.

49.context: CinematicNodeContext: stands up. Cue cinematic of her singing. At end of song put lute in magic pocket.

197.speaker: Player
197.text: Keep going. What would you say to your teacher if she were here right now?

241.speaker: Alfira
241.text: That... that it's okay. That I'll be okay.
241.context: NodeContext: Player has asked what she wants to say to her teacher (who has died). She's trying to express that she doesn't want her teacher to worry about her. That she'll do her best. And that she loves her.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: All right - that's what your lyrics need to say.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Never mind. This isn't going anywhere.

44.speaker: Alfira
44.text: Oh. Should I try something else? Be honest.
44.context: NodeContext: Looks and sounds like a kicked puppy, but means it when she says be honest.

140.speaker: Alfira
140.text: This song is for Lihala... my teacher. She - she died on the way here. I need to get this right.
140.context: NodeContext: Grief. Upset. Trying to hold it together.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: You're holding yourself back. Start over with a blank slate.

23.speaker: Alfira
23.text: But I... maybe you're right. It was broken to begin with.
23.context: NodeContext: Player has told her to start over. Doubting herself. Hurt and confused.

105.speaker: Alfira
105.text: I should start sketching out ideas. Thank you for the help, I guess.
105.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound thankful but kind of failing.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: You want honesty? Give up - you don't have the makings of a bard.

250.speaker: Alfira
250.context: NodeContext: Been told to give up her dream. Grief. Upset. Trying to hold it together.

258.speaker: Alfira
258.text: But I can't even finish this one song...

103.speaker: Alfira
103.text: Sorry, do you mind? You've given me a lot to think about.

296.speaker: Player
296.text: Forget what I said. You're doing just fine.

252.speaker: Alfira
252.text: Really? Good. That's good. Let's keep going.
252.context: NodeContext: Player has told her what she's doing works. She's almost talking to herself in reassurance.

81.speaker: Alfira
81.text: Moon... moon reminds me of your grace...
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Very gently singing. Not playing. NodeContext: Gently feeling out the words of the song, and with it, the pain and grief she feels for her teacher.

152.speaker: Alfira
152.text: All the love I can't repay...
152.context: NodeContext: Gently feeling out the words.

170.speaker: Alfira
170.context: NodeContext: Moment she realises she has the song within her grasp. Excited.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Perfectly awful. These are the worst lyrics I've ever heard.

43.speaker: Alfira
43.context: NodeContext: You sound absolutely gutted here - and you look like a kicked puppy. Player has just trashed your song.

283.speaker: Player
283.text: Let's start with the lyrics. Dance upon the stars tonight?

104.speaker: Alfira
104.text: It refers to a night on the road with my teacher, Lihala. I was fast asleep when I heard a noise.
104.context: NodeContext: Smile in her voice as she thinks of her beloved teacher and her terrible dancing.

177.speaker: Alfira
177.text: I woke up, and there she was - dancing beneath the stars... a huge smile on her face.

210.speaker: Player
210.text: The song's more important than survival? Fine - it's your life.

212.speaker: Alfira
212.text: And I'm sticking to it. Thank you ever so much.
212.context: NodeContext: Player has been condescending about her decision to play. She's determined and saracastic in her thanks.

225.speaker: Player
225.text: Snatch the lute out of her hands and smash it.

72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player grabs the lute out of Alfira's hands and smashes it on the ground.

5.speaker: Alfira
5.text: What did you do?! My teacher gave me that! And she - and she's dead, you bastard.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stands up. NodeContext: Player smashed your lute - you're hysterical and furious.

232.speaker: Alfira
232.text: I wanted to write a song for her and you - you ruined it. You ruined everything.

37.speaker: Alfira
37.text: You horrid, horrid beast. What is wrong with you?
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaches out to grab Alfira's lute. Alfira stays seated - twists her body to the side out of the way. While saying first phrase. Stands up after first phrase. Then says 'What is wrong with you?'. Holding own lute close.

286.speaker: Alfira
286.text: Get the hells away from me.
286.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding own lute close.NodeContext: Angry.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: You'd better swap that lute for a weapon. You'll need one, soon enough.

165.speaker: Alfira
165.text: Violence doesn't fix everything, you know. Music can help in ways a silly blade can't.
165.context: NodeContext: Player has insulted your instrument and told you to pick up a blade. 'the silly blade' is a play on what the player said to you.

112.speaker: Alfira
112.text: Besides, I'm not doing this for me. This is for the people I... we lost on the way here. It's important.

247.speaker: Player
247.text: To sing outward, one must look inward. Why are you writing the song?

10.speaker: Player
10.text: How can I put this? That sounded a little... unpolished.

246.speaker: Alfira
246.text: It sounded like a cat being strangled. Godsdammit.
246.context: NodeContext: Speaking of her own music. Embarassed and frustrated with herself.

184.speaker: Player
184.text: Sing: 'Words of mine will turn to ash...'
184.context: CinematicNodeContext: This a quiet scene of colloboration between two musicians -

211.speaker: Alfira
211.text: Words of mine will turn to ash... When you call the last light down...
211.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to player in surprise, brow furrowed as she closes her eyes and sings then line - then a big smile as her eyes light up. She loves the line and turns to the player for the next. NodeContext: Surprise but joy as she sings in response to the player.

264.speaker: Player
264.text: Continue singing: 'Moon reminds me of your grace...'

228.speaker: Alfira
228.text: Moon reminds me of your grace... All the love I can't repay... Rest and know that I will pray... Farewell, my dear old friend.
228.context: CinematicNodeContext: Starts singing again with the new lyricsNodeContext: Sadness in her voice as she sings.

85.speaker: Alfira
85.text: All the love I can't repay... Rest and know that I will pray... Farewell, my dear old friend.

41.speaker: Alfira
41.text: Thank you. I was having trouble... finding the words.
41.context: NodeContext: Choking up slightly. Grateful but also overwhelmed with emotion.

235.speaker: Player
235.text: You're welcome. Just keep at it.

30.speaker: Alfira
30.text: It's been so long since I... since...
30.context: NodeContext: Starting to get upset. About to cry. She hasn't played with anyone since her teacher died. With Lihala's death, she thought her gift of music was gone. Now she realises it was there all along.

9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Puts lute away in magic pocket and starts to cry.

230.speaker: Alfira
230.context: NodeContext: Bursts into tears. Upset. Embarassed and grieving.

59.speaker: Alfira
59.context: NodeContext: You're trying to pull yourself together after getting upset.

153.speaker: Alfira
153.text: I haven't finished a song since Lihala died. Haven't played at all, if I'm honest.
153.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gripping lute tightly.NodeContext: Sad and distant as she remembers the death of her teacher. Traumatised.

135.speaker: Alfira
135.text: Until now. I'd forgotten what it was like: that itch in my fingers to perfect a song.

108.speaker: Alfira
108.text: The Weeping Dawn will be my gift to her. Thank you. I... I needed this.
108.context: NodeContext: Putting her gratitude into words as best she can. Sincere and genuine.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: I'm sure your teacher would be proud to see you now.

271.speaker: Alfira
271.text: Heh. She'd yell at me for that metre. And make me play it over and over again.
271.context: NodeContext: Smile and a short laugh. Fondness and love in her voice.

285.speaker: Player
285.text: Hardly a unique tale of woe these days. Toughen up, or you won't last.

190.speaker: Alfira
190.text: You're right. She'd have said the same.
190.context: NodeContext: Love and a smile in her voice.

263.speaker: Player
263.text: Well, you've come up with a fine tribute to her.

126.speaker: Alfira
126.text: Thanks. Lihala made me love music: the sound, the feel, the thrill. But when she died... it was gone.
126.context: NodeContext: Love and sincerity in her voice at the thought of her teacher.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: It's all right. Let it all out.

179.speaker: Alfira
179.text: I don't usually - I'm all right.
179.context: NodeContext: You're trying to pull yourself together after getting upset.

261.speaker: Alfira
261.context: NodeContext: Starting to get upset. About to cry.

294.speaker: Player
294.text: Finding the words is an important part of being a singer, you know.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: That was terrible. I'll show you how it's done.

284.speaker: Player
284.text: What did that poor instrument ever do to you? You're butchering it.

196.speaker: Alfira
196.text: You think I don't know that?
196.context: NodeContext: Player has insulted her music. She's embarassed and frustrated with herself.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Listen closely. I'll show you how to do it right.

223.speaker: Alfira
223.text: My teacher always said a good musician never demands a solo.
223.context: NodeContext: Player has offered to 'show her how it was done'. Snarky and offended.

265.speaker: Alfira
265.text: And I have no time for amateurs. Thanks.
265.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turn away in dismissal. NodeContext: Curshing dismissal. Sarcastic.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Well, I don't know. Perhaps the lute had it coming.

217.speaker: Alfira
217.text: Heh. Yes, it's led quite a life of crime. I'm simply putting it out of its misery...
217.context: NodeContext: Laughs. Playing along with the player's jokes about her lute.

138.speaker: Alfira
138.text: ...by slowly killing it with this song. Urgh. I can't... nothing fits, you know?

188.speaker: Player
188.text: It's a bad song, plain and simple.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: I take it back. What you're doing is perfect.

281.speaker: Alfira
281.text: Thank goodness. I feel like I'm so close. Let me try again.

272.speaker: Player
272.text: Maybe the life of a bard just isn't for you.

115.speaker: Alfira
115.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself. Sings the opening.

57.speaker: Alfira
57.text: This song will be the death of me.
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with self.

124.speaker: Alfira
124.text: I started fresh with that song.
124.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.

280.speaker: Alfira
280.text: I haven't, well, come up with anything yet. But I'm sure it'll come to me... eventually.
280.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.

207.speaker: Alfira
207.text: Why would someone do that? Why would someone destroy my lute?
207.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is standing next to the rock.NodeContext: Utterly furious and angry

218.speaker: Alfira
218.text: I just wanted to - to thank her. To honour her, you know? And now I'll never finish her eulogy.
218.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is standing next to the rock.NodeContext: Griefing - upset. On the brink of crying.

236.speaker: Alfira
236.text: How could you break it?! I hope - I hope you're ripped apart by gnolls, you beast.
236.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is standing next to the rock.NodeContext: Utterly furious and angry

253.speaker: Alfira
253.text: I shouldn't have let that lute out of my sight. I'm an idiot.
253.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is standing next to the rock.NodeContext: Someone stole her lute. It was all she had left of her teacher's. She feels stupid and like it's her fault.

202.speaker: Player
202.text: It was just a joke. Here's your lute.

233.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gives lute to Alfira.

139.speaker: Alfira
139.text: What?! Is it - ? No scratches, strings seem intact...
139.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking over the lute to make sure it's okay. NodeContext: Player returned her lute. Surprised. Suspicious. Checking the instrument.

20.speaker: Alfira
20.text: Look, thank you for returning it, but just - just leave me alone.
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dismissal. Backing away almost. NodeContext: Grateful to have it back, but doesn't trust the player. Angry and pleading.

255.speaker: Alfira
255.text: Leave me be. I'm in the middle of something.
255.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing - luteNodeContext: Stern but friendly.

257.speaker: Alfira
257.text: It's still rough, but my song is getting there!
257.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard is sitting on the rock.NodeContext: Her song is on the way to being finished. Happy and full of hope - thought she'd never player again.

278.speaker: Alfira
278.text: Don't come near me. I mean it.
278.context: NodeContext: Upset. Angry. And a little scared. Player stole her lute and she wants nothing to do with them.
